🎄 2020 Christmas Journal 1

Dec 23, 2020 KnowsCount Dec 23, 2020 KnowsCount

I’ve done a few things this week and shall hereby record them.

I’ve done a few things this week and shall hereby record them.

I have, firstly, started this blog.

Coding

I also kept making contributions to GitHub over the past … well, more than a month.

I have created, and contributed to a few repositories, too. I, for instance, contributed to the new client of hack chat (it looks like this), a minimal, distraction-free chat app (though it somewhat caused more internationalisation issues); started a ReactJS tutorial page; fixed a fatal bug on the beta-version project NKCS Storage System (the current fatal issues are the potential security vulnerabilities in dependencies); sketched the basic framework (outline) of the WeeBlog project, ‘a beauteous content sharing platform solution orchestrated to be sexy and concise’; made a simple photo-wall for one of my cyber-security friend under his request as his birthday is approaching; forked and changed some bit of the project logoly which is not appropriate for one to describe here.

I am also shifting from using npm as my node package manager (even though npm stands for node package manager) to Facebook’s yarn. I know, I don’t like Zuckerberg, and I don’t like Facebook. But what can I do?– My favourite ReactJS is developed by Facebook and yarn is just great.

Books

I, under the demand of my Chinese teacher, finished a part of The Gay Genius: The Life and Times of Su DongPo wherein the word Gay is used the old-fashioned way. Fun fact: this book is a masterpiece writ by a Chinese writer named Lin Yutang, yet it was an English book – the version I am reading is translated into Chinese.

As for my English homework, I have been reading The prisoner of Zenda. I planned to read Edgar Allan Poe’s at first, but has given up.

Homework

I have done my Chinese homework but the reading part; a part of Maths homework. I plan to finish the poster and therefore Science homework today (on 23 Dec).

Video Games

Two days ago I played video games the whole morning, and nothing remarkable happened. It was that evening when I. intentionally, deleted a Europa Universalis savegame which I spent tens of hours on… I was Great Britain in the savegame, and was therefore too strong, and the game thereby became boring.

Telly Shows

I started watching Silicon Valley again – the third time, also the funeral episode of The IT crowd which I watched over and over for a few million times.
